definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: The key is to choose energy-enhancing, health-invigorating foods.
sentences.chinese: 重要的是要选择那些高能量，健康的食品。

sentences.english: Radiation therapy uses high-energy radiation to kill cells.
sentences.chinese: 反射治疗用高能量射线杀死细胞。

sentences.english: The upper layer of dye intercepts high-energy light, such as ultraviolet.
sentences.chinese: 上层的染料拦截象紫外线这样高能量的光线。

sentences.english: Summary: Displaced intra-articular fractures of the glenoid are rare and frequently result from high-energy injuries.
sentences.chinese: 移位的肩胛盂骨折是少见的有高能量损伤引起的骨折。

sentences.english: In this paper the high energy sensitivity characteristics of the Mossbauer effect is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要介绍穆斯堡尔效应高能量灵敏度的特性。

sentences.english: A further advantage is the high energy density of the tides.
sentences.chinese: 另一项优势是潮汐的高能量密度。

sentences.english: This kind of high-powered battery is produced with the latest technology.
sentences.chinese: 这种高能量电池采用的是最新生产技术。

sentences.english: High energy density means that there are a lot of calories in a little food.
sentences.chinese: 高能量密度意味着少量食物里含有大量卡路里。

sentences.english: And high energies are needed because the Higgs is thought to be quite heavy.
sentences.chinese: 之所以需要高能量是因为希格斯粒子被认为非常重。

sentences.english: The world's most powerful X-ray machines are a byproduct of high-energy physics.
sentences.chinese: 世界上最强大的X光机是高能量物理学的一种副产品。

sentences.english: These yogurts can often replace a high-calorie dessert.
sentences.chinese: 这些奶酪可以取代高能量甜点。
干果是一种非常高能量的食品。

sentences.english: Quantitative predictions are made for future experiments at higher bom-barding energies.
sentences.chinese: 模型对未来更高能量的实验作了预言。

sentences.english: So, lower probability for higher energy.
sentences.chinese: 所以，高能量态的概率更小。

sentences.english: The write-back cache batteries are high energy devices.
sentences.chinese: 回写高速缓存电池是高能量设备。

definition: to absorb (nutrients etc)/to assimilate/intake/to take a photograph of (a scene)
fat (in the body, in a plant, or in food)
